get.description: Provides the Open API specification of the Adamik API

200.description: Returns the OpenAPI spec of the Adamik API, in JSON format

get.description: Retrieves a list of all supported blockchain networks with their detailed information.

200.description: Returns a list of names and detailed information for all supported blockchain networks.

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific blockchain network identified by chain ID.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Unique adamik identifier of the chain

200.description: Successfully returns detailed data about the specified blockchain, including its identifier, name, family classification, supported units of currency, and additional configuration parameters.

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific token for a blockchain network, identified by chain ID and token ID.

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: Token ID. Format depends on the chain, e.g. contract address for EVM chains.

schema.description: Token ID. Format depends on the chain, e.g. contract address for EVM chains.

200.description: Returns detailed data about the token on the specified blockchain.

get.description: Lists validators for a specified chain ID, including their operational status and commission rates. Useful for delegation operations on proof-of-stake blockchains.

parameters.name: nextPage
parameters.description: Token from the previous response of this endpoint. Provide it here to fetch the next page of results.

schema.description: Token from the previous response of this endpoint. Provide it here to fetch the next page of results.

200.description: Returns a list of validators, their status, and commission details for the specified chain ID.

nextPage.description: Use the token from the previous response to retrieve the next page of results.

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific transaction for a blockchain network, identified by chain ID and transaction ID.

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: Transaction ID. Usually a hash but can be different depending on the chain.

schema.description: Transaction ID. Usually a hash but can be different depending on the chain.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Optional filter to request specific data. Use a single 'include' parameter with comma-separated values. Possible values are 'parsed' and 'raw'.

schema.description: Optional filter to request specific data. Use a single 'include' parameter with comma-separated values. Possible values are 'parsed' and 'raw'.

200.description: Successfully returns detailed data about the transaction on the specified blockchain.

amount.description: Amount to use, either provided or computed by the API

ticker.description: Specific currency for that amount. If not provided, the amount is in the native currency of the chain.

gas.description: Transaction gas computed by the API, when relevant for the chain.

nonce.description: Transaction sequence number, when relevant for the chain.

memo.description: Optional free text field, that is supported for some chains.

amount.description: Amount to use, either provided or computed by the API

ticker.description: Specific currency for that amount. If not provided, the amount is in the native currency of the chain.

amount.description: Amount to use, either provided or computed by the API

ticker.description: Specific currency for that amount. If not provided, the amount is in the native currency of the chain.

amount.description: Amount to use, either provided or computed by the API

ticker.description: Specific currency for that amount. If not provided, the amount is in the native currency of the chain.

amount.description: Amount to use, either provided or computed by the API

ticker.description: Specific currency for that amount. If not provided, the amount is in the native currency of the chain.

post.description: Encodes the provided public key to one or multiple addresses, for the given chain ID.       Each address is labeled with a type, which may be "default" when there is only one address.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Unique adamik identifier of the chain

200.description: Returns a set of addresses, one for each supported type, depending on the chain

post.description: Validates the specified address for the given chain ID, returning true if the address is valid, otherwise false.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Unique adamik identifier of the chain

200.description: Returns true if the address is valid for the specified chain ID, otherwise false.

get.description: Returns the state of a specified account identifier (address or xpub) and chain ID, focusing on balance information. The response includes details on native asset balances, token balances, and staking balances. This endpoint supports optional filters to refine the results, making it essential for wallet applications to display accurate and tailored account information.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Account identifier (address, xpub, etc) for the specified chain ID

schema.description: Account identifier (address, xpub, etc) for the specified chain ID

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Optional filter to request specific data. Use a single 'include' parameter with comma-separated values.

schema.description: Optional filter to request specific data. Use a single 'include' parameter with comma-separated values.

parameters.name: pubkey
parameters.description: Optional public key (in hex format) associated with the accountId. Required for Bitcoin's Babylon Staking data.

schema.description: Optional public key (in hex format) associated with the accountId. Required for Bitcoin's Babylon Staking data.

200.description: Returns the current balance information for the specified address and chain ID.

available.description: Amount of native currency that is immediately available for using. This excludes amounts that are locked in staking positions.

unconfirmed.description: Amount of native currency that is either pending (mempool) or not yet fully confirmed (not enough block confirmations). Relevant for chains with long confirmation times (like Bitcoin).

total.description: Total amount of native currency owned by the account, including both available and locked amounts (staking positions).

amount.description: Current balance of this token owned by the account. The amount is expressed in the token's smallest unit (based on its decimals).

total.description: Total amount of native currency involved in staking positions (locked + unlocking + unlocked).

locked.description: Amount of native currency currently locked in staking positions.

unlocking.description: Amount of native currency that is in the process of being unstaked (during unbonding period).

unlocked.description: Amount of native currency that has completed the unbonding period and is ready to be withdrawn.

stakeId.description: Unique identifier for the staking position.

validatorAddresses.description: List of validator addresses involved in staking position.

amount.description: Amount of native currency used in this specific staking position.

completionDate.description: Unix timestamp (in milliseconds) when the current position status will expire, when relevant.

positions.description: Detailed list of individual staking positions.

amount.description: Amount of unclaimed staking rewards in native currency from this validator.

native.description: List of unclaimed staking rewards in native currency, per validator.

amount.description: Amount of unclaimed staking rewards in this token. The amount is expressed in the token's smallest unit.

rewards.description: Information about unclaimed staking rewards, both in native currency and tokens.

get.description: Returns the tokens (amount and details) held by a specified account identifier and chain ID. This endpoint allows for pagination over the returned tokens.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Account identifier (address, xpub, etc) for the specified chain ID

schema.description: Account identifier (address, xpub, etc) for the specified chain ID

parameters.name: nextPage
parameters.description: Token from the previous response of this endpoint. Provide it here to fetch the next page of results.

schema.description: Token from the previous response of this endpoint. Provide it here to fetch the next page of results.

200.description: Returns the current tokens information for the specified address and chain ID.

amount.description: Current balance of this token owned by the account. The amount is expressed in the token's smallest unit (based on its decimals).

nextPage.description: Use the token from the previous response to retrieve the next page of results.

get.description: Returns the history of a specified account identifier (address or xpub) and chain ID, primarily focusing on past transactions.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Account identifier (address, xpub, etc) for the specified chain ID

schema.description: Account identifier (address, xpub, etc) for the specified chain ID

parameters.name: nextPage
parameters.description: Token from the previous response of this endpoint. Provide it here to fetch the next page of results.

schema.description: Token from the previous response of this endpoint. Provide it here to fetch the next page of results.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Optional filter to request specific data. Use a single 'include' parameter with comma-separated values. Possible values are 'parsed' and 'raw'.

schema.description: Optional filter to request specific data. Use a single 'include' parameter with comma-separated values. Possible values are 'parsed' and 'raw'.

200.description: Returns the current list of transactions for the specified address and chain ID.

amount.description: Amount to use, either provided or computed by the API

ticker.description: Specific currency for that amount. If not provided, the amount is in the native currency of the chain.

gas.description: Transaction gas computed by the API, when relevant for the chain.

nonce.description: Transaction sequence number, when relevant for the chain.

memo.description: Optional free text field, that is supported for some chains.

amount.description: Amount to use, either provided or computed by the API

ticker.description: Specific currency for that amount. If not provided, the amount is in the native currency of the chain.

amount.description: Amount to use, either provided or computed by the API

ticker.description: Specific currency for that amount. If not provided, the amount is in the native currency of the chain.

amount.description: Amount to use, either provided or computed by the API

ticker.description: Specific currency for that amount. If not provided, the amount is in the native currency of the chain.

amount.description: Amount to use, either provided or computed by the API

ticker.description: Specific currency for that amount. If not provided, the amount is in the native currency of the chain.

nextPage.description: Use the token from the previous response to retrieve the next page of results.

post.description: Encodes transaction data into a format suitable for broadcasting. This function is pivotal for creating transactions that comply with the specific requirements of different blockchains.        It also completes the input transaction with computed data, such as fees and max spendable amount, and performs some chain-specific validation checks on the transaction.

memo.description: Optional free text field, that is supported for some chains.

format.description: Controls the format of the returned encoded transaction. DEPRECATED, will be reworked at some point.

senderPubKey.description: Public key of the sender account, required in some situations. It is advised to provide it by default if you can.

contractType.description: Provider of the account contract. Only ArgentX is supported at the moment.

oneOf.title: Deploy Account
oneOf.description: Deploy a smart contract wallet account

senderAddress.description: Address or ID of the sender account.

senderPubKey.description: Public key of the sender account, required in some situations. It is advised to provide it by default if you can.

recipientAddress.description: Address or ID of the recipient account.

amount.description: Optional amount to use (always in smallest unit). Use either this or useMaxAmount.

useMaxAmount.description: Option to let the API compute the amount to use all available funds. Either use this or provide amount.

senderAddress.description: Address or ID of the sender account.

senderPubKey.description: Public key of the sender account, required in some situations. It is advised to provide it by default if you can.

sourceValidatorAddress.description: Address or ID of a validator. Can be used to move staking funds from this validator instead of the sender's balance, if supported by the chain.

targetValidatorAddress.description: Address or ID of a validator

amount.description: Optional amount to use (always in smallest unit). Use either this or useMaxAmount.

useMaxAmount.description: Option to let the API compute the amount to use all available funds. Either use this or provide amount.

tokenId.description: Unique ID of the token to transfer (e.g contract address for EVM chains)

senderAddress.description: Address or ID of the sender account.

senderPubKey.description: Public key of the sender account, required in some situations. It is advised to provide it by default if you can.

recipientAddress.description: Address or ID of the recipient account.

useMaxAmount.description: Option to let the API compute the amount to use all available funds. Either use this or provide amount.

senderPubKey.description: Public key of the sender account, required in some situations. It is advised to provide it by default if you can.

validatorAddress.description: Address or ID of a validator

stakeId.description: Unique identifier of a staking position. Only required for Babylon staking at the moment (documentation will come soon).

useMaxAmount.description: Option to let the API compute the amount to use all available funds. Either use this or provide amount.

senderAddress.description: Address or ID of the sender account.

senderPubKey.description: Public key of the sender account, required in some situations. It is advised to provide it by default if you can.

validatorAddress.description: Address or ID of a validator

stakeId.description: Unique identifier of a staking position. Only required for Babylon staking at the moment (documentation will come soon).

compound.description: When available for the chain, controls whether staking rewards are cashed or added to the staked funds.

senderPubKey.description: Public key of the sender account, required in some situations. It is advised to provide it by default if you can.

validatorAddress.description: Address or ID of a validator

stakeId.description: Unique identifier of a staking position. Only required for Babylon staking at the moment (documentation will come soon).

oneOf.title: Withdraw Unlocked Funds
oneOf.description: Only supported for Babylon staking at the moment (documentation will come soon).

senderPubKey.description: Public key of the sender account, required in some situations. It is advised to provide it by default if you can.

senderForeignPubKey.description: Staker's pubkey on the foreign chain. (hex)

senderAddress.description: Address or ID of the sender account.

proofOfPossession.description: staker's address on this chain, signed with the foreign chain's signer. (hex)

amount.description: Staked amount on the foreign chain.

validatorPubKey.description: Validator's pubkey on the foreign chain. (hex)

unsignedUnbondingTransaction.description: Unsigned unbonding transaction on the foreign chain (as provided in the response of the encode request for the stake transaction).

signedStakingTransaction.description: Signed staking transaction on the foreign chain (hex).

signedSlashingTransaction.description: Signed slashing transaction on the foreign chain (hex).

signedUnbondingSlashingTransaction.description: Signed unbonding slashing transaction on the foreign chain (hex).

oneOf.title: Register Stake
oneOf.description: Only supported for Babylon staking at the moment (documentation will come soon).

format.description: Controls the format of the returned encoded transaction. DEPRECATED, will be reworked at some point.

params.description: Some additional chain-specific context computed by the API. If provided by the encode endpoint, it must be provided back as-is to the broadcast endpoint.

200.description: Provides validation results, including any errors or warnings related to the transaction.

post.description:
Broadcasts a signed transaction to the blockchain, crucial for submitting transactions like transfers, delegations, or reward claims. Returns a transaction receipt (hash) or error details.


Note: the exact same 'data' and 'encoded' fields that were retrieved with the /transaction/encode endpoint, must be provided here.

gas.description: Transaction gas, when relevant for the chain.

nonce.description: Transaction sequence number computed by the API, when relevant for the chain.

memo.description: Optional free text field, that is supported for some chains.

format.description: Controls the format of the returned encoded transaction. DEPRECATED, will be reworked at some point.

params.description: Some additional chain-specific context computed by the API. If provided by the encode endpoint, it must be provided back as-is to the broadcast endpoint.

senderPubKey.description: Public key of the sender account, required in some situations. It is advised to provide it by default if you can.

contractType.description: Provider of the account contract. Only ArgentX is supported at the moment.

200.description: Returns a transaction receipt or error details if the transaction fails.

post.description: Broadcasts a signed transaction to the blockchain in raw format.         Unlike the standard broadcast, which builds the broadcast payload for you, this endpoint requires the final payload, ready for submission.         Returns the transaction receipt (hash) or error details in case of failure.

200.description: Returns a transaction receipt or error details if the transaction fails.

ChainId.description: Unique adamik identifier of the chain

ChainSupportedFeatures.description: List of supported features for the chain

SignerSpec.description: List of signer specificity for the chain
